name: Product Requirements Document
description: Standard PRD template with problem definition, user stories, technical specs, and rollout planning

sections.title: Feature Name
sections.description: The name of the feature being specified
promptHints: What is the name of this feature?
Do you have a working title or codename?

sections.title: Problem & Users
sections.description: The core problem this feature solves, who is impacted, and any supporting evidence like user feedback or usage data
promptHints: What is the core problem or pain point this feature aims to solve?
Who is impacted by this problem? Describe their role, workflows, or behavior.
Do you have any supporting evidence like user feedback, complaints, usage data, or customer quotes?

sections.title: Outcome & Metrics
sections.description: Business outcomes this feature supports and measurable success metrics including adoption, reduction in issues, and satisfaction improvements
promptHints: What business outcomes does this feature support? (e.g. revenue, retention, deflection, CSAT)
What are the target success metrics? Think in terms of X% adoption, Y% reduction in issues, Z% improvement in satisfaction.
What timeframe are you targeting for these metrics?

sections.title: Scope
sections.description: What features, components, flows, and user scenarios are in scope, and what is explicitly excluded
promptHints: What features, components, or flows are included in this work?
What is explicitly out of scope? This helps manage expectations.
Are there any features being deferred to a future phase?

sections.title: User Stories
sections.description: Key user interactions in 'As a [user], I want to [action], so that [value]' format. Include 2-5 action-focused stories.
promptHints: Walk me through the key user interactions. Who does what, and why?
Can you describe 2-5 user stories in the format: As a [user], I want to [do something], so that [I get value]?
What are the most critical user actions for this feature?

sections.title: User Flows / UX Links
sections.description: Primary user journeys described step-by-step, links to UX designs or Figma, and edge cases like errors, timeouts, or missing data
promptHints: Can you describe the main step-by-step user journey?
Are there any UX designs or Figma links available?
What edge cases should we consider? Think about errors, timeouts, missing data, empty states.

sections.title: APIs / Schema Changes
sections.description: New API endpoints, changes to existing APIs, and database schema or object structure updates
promptHints: Are there any new API endpoints needed? What method, purpose, and ownership?
Are there changes to existing APIs? Any parameters or behaviors being added or removed?
Are there any database schema or object structure changes required?

sections.title: Constraints & Risks
sections.description: Technical constraints (performance, latency, architecture), UX/legal/compliance constraints, and risks or unknowns
promptHints: Are there any technical constraints like performance, latency, or architecture challenges?
Any UX, legal, or compliance constraints? For example data retention, accessibility, or privacy rules.
What risks or unknowns exist? What could go wrong?

sections.title: Acceptance Criteria
sections.description: Specific conditions in Gherkin format (Given/When/Then) that must be met for the feature to be considered complete
promptHints: What needs to be true for this feature to be considered complete?
Can you describe acceptance criteria in Given/When/Then format?
What are the pass/fail conditions for each key scenario?

sections.title: Telemetry / Tracking
sections.description: Events to track with names and descriptions, and a validation plan for measuring success and adoption
promptHints: What events should be tracked? Give each a name and description.
How will you measure success and adoption after launch?
What analytics or dashboards are needed?

sections.title: Rollout / Rollback Plan + Flags
sections.description: Feature flag strategy (default OFF), rollout plan (e.g. 0% to internal to beta to 100%), rollback plan, and dependencies
promptHints: What is the feature flag strategy? Should it default to OFF?
What is the rollout plan? e.g. 0% then internal then beta users then 100%
What happens if we need to rollback? Is it safe?
Are there any dependencies on design, API, ops, or sequencing?

sections.title: Open Questions
sections.description: Issues or questions that need resolution before development can begin
promptHints: Are there any unresolved questions that need answers before development?
What decisions are still pending?
Is there anything blocked or waiting on other teams?

sections.title: Notes
sections.description: Relevant context, historical decisions, or links to prior work
promptHints: Is there any relevant historical context or prior work?
Any important decisions that were already made?
Any useful links or references to include?
